CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 14+P1-1-1 - Prohibition of discrimination (Article 14 - Discrimination) (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Possessions;Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property);Pecuniary and non-pecuniary damage - award (Article 41 - Non-pecuniary damage;Pecuniary damage;Just satisfaction)
JUDGES: András Sajó;Krzysztof Wojtyczek;Nona Tsotsoria;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque;Vincent A. De Gaetano
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant , already in receipt of an old - age pension , took up employment with GPE as a civil servant , as of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE an amendment to LAW entered into force , according to which the disbursement of those old - age pensions whose beneficiaries are simultaneously employed within certain categories of the public sector will be suspended for the duration of their employment . No such restriction was put in place in respect of those who are in receipt of an old - age pension while being employed within the private sector .
CARDINAL . In application of this new rule , on DATE the disbursement of the applicant ’s pension was suspended . The applicant ’s administrative appeal to ORG was to no avail .
